greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T2[n,k] = Sum_{partitions of n with k parts p(n, k; m_1, m_2, m_3, ..., m_n)} c(n; m_1, m_2, ..., m_n) * x_1^m_1 * x_2^m_2 * ... x^n*m_n, where x_i = i-th prime.
comment: Here c(n; m_1, m_2, ..., m_n) = n! / (m_1!*1!^m_1 * m_2!*2!^m_2 * ... * m_n!*n!^m_n) is the number of ways to realize the partition p(n, k; m_1, m_2, m_3, ..., m_n).
Also the Bell transform of the prime numbers. For the definition of the Bell transform see A264428. - _Peter Luschny_, Jan 29 2016
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..141, flattened
Tilman Neumann, More terms, partitions generator and transform implementation
maple: b:= proc(n) option remember; expand(`if`(n=0, 1, add(x
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=1..n))(b(n)):
# The function BellMatrix is defined in A264428.
mathematica: b[n_] := b[n] = Expand[If[n == 0, 1, Sum[x*Binomial[n - 1, j - 1]*Prime[j]* b[n - j], {j, 1, n}]]]; T[n_] := Function [p, Table[Coefficient[p, x, i], {i, 1, n}]][b[n]]; Table[T[n], {n, 1, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 23 2016, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
BellMatrix[f_, len_] := With[{t = Array[f, len, 0]}, Table[BellY[n, k, t], {n, 0, len - 1}, {k, 0, len - 1}]];
Table[B[[n, k]], {n, 2, rows}, {k, 2, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 28 2018, after _Peter Luschny_ *)
